rev.comment: added external links and a bit more of text
rev.diff:
Line 317: Line 317:
==Vendor support==
==Vendor support==
â
A number of vendors offer computers with Ubuntu pre-installed, including [[Hasee]], [[Dell]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/dell |title=Ubuntu on Dell |publisher=Canonical |accessdate=24 February 2008}}</ref> [[Tesco]], OP3, Gliese IT, System76,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dell.com/content/topics/segtopic.aspx/linux_3x?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs |title=Ubuntu Customers |publisher=[[Dell]] |accessdate=19 August 2008}}</ref> [[Sharp Corporation]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liliputing.com/2009/08/sharp-netwalker-pc-z1-what-you-get-when-you-shrink-a-netbook.html |title=Sharp NetWalker PC-Z1: What you get when you shrink a netbook |publisher=Liliputing |accessdate=26 March 2010}}</ref> and the South African company Bravium Computers.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bravium.co.za/about |title=Ubuntu Computers |publisher=Bravium Computers |accessdate=23 April 2009}}</ref> Dell and System76 customers are able to choose between 30-day, three-month, and yearly Ubuntu support plans through Canonical.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/system76-certified-servers |title=System76 announces servers with Ubuntu 7.10 and Canonical support services |publisher=Canonical |accessdate=5 March 2008}}</ref> Dell computers (running Ubuntu 10.04) include extra support for [[ATI]] Video Graphics, Dell Wireless, [[Fingerprint Readers]], [[HDMI]], [[Bluetooth]], [[DVD-Video|DVD]] playback (using [[LinDVD]]), and [[MP3]]/[[Windows Media Audio|WMA]]/[[Windows Media Video|WMV]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://yourblog.dell.com/2008/07/18/dell-upgrades-consumer-linux-pcs-to-ubuntu-804/ |title=Your Blog " Blog Archive " Dell Upgrades Consumer Linux PCs to Ubuntu 8.04 |publisher=Dell |accessdate=13 September 2008}}</ref>[[Asus]] is also selling some [[Asus Eee PC]]s with Ubuntu pre-installed, namely the 1001PXD, 1011PX and 1015PX models.<ref>http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/asus-preloads-eee-pc-models-with-ubuntu-10022619/</ref><ref>http://www.theinquirer.net/inquirer/news/2075819/asus-preload-ubuntu-linux-eee-pcs</ref><ref>http://www.tomshardware.com/news/Ubuntu-Eee-PC-Seashell-Netbooks-Canonical,12878.html</ref>
+
A number of vendors offer computers with Ubuntu pre-installed, including [[Hasee]], [[Dell]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/dell |title=Ubuntu on Dell |publisher=Canonical |accessdate=24 February 2008}}</ref> [[Tesco]], OP3, Gliese IT, System76,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dell.com/content/topics/segtopic.aspx/linux_3x?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs |title=Ubuntu Customers |publisher=[[Dell]] |accessdate=19 August 2008}}</ref> [[Sharp Corporation]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liliputing.com/2009/08/sharp-netwalker-pc-z1-what-you-get-when-you-shrink-a-netbook.html |title=Sharp NetWalker PC-Z1: What you get when you shrink a netbook |publisher=Liliputing |accessdate=26 March 2010}}</ref> and the South African company Bravium Computers.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bravium.co.za/about |title=Ubuntu Computers |publisher=Bravium Computers |accessdate=23 April 2009}}</ref> Dell and System76 customers are able to choose between 30-day, three-month, and yearly Ubuntu support plans through Canonical.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/system76-certified-servers |title=System76 announces servers with Ubuntu 7.10 and Canonical support services |publisher=Canonical |accessdate=5 March 2008}}</ref> Dell computers (running Ubuntu 10.04) include extra support for [[ATI]] Video Graphics, Dell Wireless, [[Fingerprint Readers]], [[HDMI]], [[Bluetooth]], [[DVD-Video|DVD]] playback (using [[LinDVD]]), and [[MP3]]/[[Windows Media Audio|WMA]]/[[Windows Media Video|WMV]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://yourblog.dell.com/2008/07/18/dell-upgrades-consumer-linux-pcs-to-ubuntu-804/ |title=Your Blog " Blog Archive " Dell Upgrades Consumer Linux PCs to Ubuntu 8.04 |publisher=Dell |accessdate=13 September 2008}}</ref>[[Asus]] is also selling some [[Asus Eee PC]]s with Ubuntu pre-installed, namely the [http://commercial.asus.com/product/detail/102 1001PXD], [http://www.asus.com/Eee/Eee_PC/Eee_PC_1011PX/ 1011PX] and [http://www.asus.com/Eee/Eee_PC/Eee_PC_1015PX/ 1015PX] models, announcing that "many more" Eee PC models running Ubuntu will be available in 2011<ref>http://www.theinquirer.net/inquirer/news/2075819/asus-preload-ubuntu-linux-eee-pcs</ref><ref>http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/asus-preloads-eee-pc-models-with-ubuntu-10022619/</ref><ref>http://www.tomshardware.com/news/Ubuntu-Eee-PC-Seashell-Netbooks-Canonical,12878.html</ref>
